plentry.pd: Absolute path to save the recording file locally, including file name and extension. For example: C:\music\audio.aac. Make sure the specified path exists and is writable.

Whether to encode the audio data:
: Encode the audio data using AAC.
: (default) Do not encode, save the raw recorded audio data.

pd.note: If you set this parameter to 44100 or 48000, to ensure recording quality, it is recommended to record in WAV format or AAC files with quality set to AudioRecordingQualityMedium or AudioRecordingQualityHigh.

plentry.pd: Recording quality. See . This parameter applies to AAC files only.

pd.note:
The actual recorded audio channel depends on the captured audio channel:
If the captured audio is mono and recordingChannel is set to 2, the recorded audio will be stereo with duplicated mono data, not true stereo.
If the captured audio is stereo and recordingChannel is set to 1, the recorded audio will be mono with mixed stereo data. Additionally, the integration scheme may affect the final recorded audio channel. If you want to record stereo, please [contact technical support](https://ticket.shengwang.cn/) for assistance.
